subject: South of the Border
event: Strange to say, although I have lived in New Mexico since 1979, I have never really visited Old Mexico. Oh, I attended a Westercon in El Paso a few years back, and spent an afternoon in Juarez with some other fans and writers. And I spent a few hours in Tijuana back in the late 80s, I believe, while attending Comicon in San Diego. But that hardly counts. There's a lot more to Mexico than the border towns. My first real visit to Mexico starts tomorrow, when I jet down to Guadalajara for the Guadalajara International Book Fair: https://www.fil.com.mx/ingles/i_info/i_info_fil.asp I'm one of the guests at the conference. I'll be doing interviews, a press conference, a live streaming event, and a signing. I expect I will be doing some tequila tasting as well. I am informed that Guadalajara is the tequila capital of Mexico. I am looking forward to meeting my Mexican publishers, editors, and fans. This is my last scheduled event for 2016. My appearance schedule for 2017 is very limited, and will remain so until WINDS is completed. So if you want to meet me or get a book signed, this will be the last chance for a good few months... See you south of the border.

comments.article:
What are the chances of you staying in Mexico during the construction of Trump's wall/fence? I have a vision of you uniting all of the deadly Mexican cartels who have been at war with one another for years. They all rally to your leadership and destroy the barrier for the hope of living in America and someday owning their own landscaping business.

Could I pitch this to your publishers? Sort of a Hemingway meets Mance Rayder idea.
comments.subject: King-Beyond-Trump's Wall

comments.article: I like this idea and wish to subscribe to your newsletter.
comments.subject: RE: King-Beyond-Trump's Wall

comments.article: Wanted to be there just to ask you: "-Hey GRRM, when Brandon the Builder built the wall did he ever consider making the White Walkers pay for it?" and bring the house down :-)

I hope that you enjoy this visit, firstable an apologize for the fans who will ask for the realese date of winds of winter, was an contest to the opportunity to ask something in the talk of Friday, and is so possible that the question is about the date, sorry for that.

When do you will be singing? At the program is only a talk, Without signing of book, and I really want a sign.
comments.subject: Welcome to Guadalajara

comments.article: Is the signing just for the people who got tickets for your conference? Or people in general, sadly I discovered too late that you were coming to Guadalajara and i didnt get anythe tickets, would love if you could sign a copy of your last book for me though :(
comments.subject: Guadalajara book fair

comments.article:
If I can't get a sign book, I hope that you could read us a New chapter, that would be amazing. Was a contest to Win the opportunity to get into the conference, the ticket ran out in minutes, was crazy... See you on Friday :3

You will be another day at FIL? Or you enjoy the city these day before the Friday?

Have a great day
comments.subject: Is there an opportunity of a New chapter?

comments.article: There's no reading scheduled, alas.

RE: Re: Is there an opportunity of a New chapter?

comments.article:
Welcome to México! *
I hope you have an amazing time here. I was hoping to meet you in person, but it was a bloodbath to get tickets to your conference. I seriously tried. Lots of people here love your books. Enjoy!

Hey Mr. Martin! It´s great that you´re coming to my hometown! I may be a journalist, but on the day you visit I will first and foremost be a big fan! I´ll keep my fingers crossed I can meet you and that you enjoy Guadalajara :D

...if you find the time, let me know, I'd love to beat you in a game of chess ..... for secrets, of course.....

I realize it's a lot for you to lose, and I'd beat you handily, but if you feel like a bit of a gamble.......



Remember, as Jaqen H'ghar once said, "Valar Loseghulis" ....
comments.subject: Chess for Secrets....

comments.article: I haven't played chess in decades (though once upon a time I was pretty good).
comments.subject: Re: Chess for Secrets....

comments.article:
Hello mr. George, I really hope you enjoy coming to my hometown. I can tell people is very excited to meet you (since I couldn't obtain tickets for the meet & greet, nor the conference).

I only ask for two things: 1 - try authentic tacos or burritos (I'd suggest "Los burritos de Moyahua") and 2 - live a lot of things with mexican people, because our cultura is really rich, and we are much more than a stereotype.

Oh, and I was hoping to ask you this personally but since I won't be able, here it goes number 3 - plase tell me if Sallahador's name is based on "Salvador", because if so, he and I would be (like we say here) "tocayos" and I might even add it as an alias in my Facebook page.

I hope you come to Mexico many more times in the future!
¡Espero que vengas a México muchas más veces en el futuro!

comments.upictitle: I was cheerleader but kids called me a goth: pic#124783567
comments.article:
I got tickets for the event but not for the signing which bums me out but I'm excited nonetheless.

I hope you enjoy your stay.

Hey Mr. Martin,

I will definitely be tuning into the streams. I know WOW has had you very busy, but thanks for still trying to find time to spend with fans, it really means a lot. Have fun with the tequila tasting :)

I hope that you can get back to Mexico someday  so I can meet you,  there are a lot of fans of your amazing work here in Mexico , and this time was very difficult to get tickets, hope you the best of the stances!!

Hi George, my best regards to you.

When you say "good few months" that is really few months or was just a expressiom ?

I'm asking this to avoid hyped news that flood the internet

Sorry if I was inconvenient.

Cheers.
It will be a few good months between Guadalajara and my next public appearance.  That's hardly news.  The dates are all on my appearances page on my website, and have been for months,
Did not know you were going to be signing books, do you have any specific information? See you on friday (with another 2000 people)
comments.subject: Signing date

comments.article: The signing is on Saturday, 11am to 12:30.
comments.subject: Re: Signing date

comments.article: It Will be great to ser you. Have my tickets already. Hope you enjoy at least the goat birria, which is our typical food Dish here at Guadalajara.
comments.subject: Nice yo have you here

comments.article:
Hello Ser,

I was looking at your appearances for next year to see if you were going to be close, and I saw you're going to be in Long Beach, where I live. But your website says May 10-15, Stokercon's says April 28-30, could you verify? And also do you think you'll be doing book signings there?

Thank you,

Eric
comments.subject: Conventions

comments.article:
Yes, probably.

Best have my minions check that date, I guess.
comments.subject: Re: Conventions

comments.article: Try mezcal, ser, in the tequila capital.  A drink as complex and rewarding as Jaime Lannister circa A Feast for Crows.
if you look into property while you're down there, some sort of fallback plan, i don't think any of us would blame ya. have a safe trip. :)

Hey Mr. Martin,

I just want to say thank you for the heads up on where you're at and update on how things have been going.

I also want you to know something: it's okay. I've read some of your posts and I understand that WOW hasn't gone as you had originally hoped. But really, it's okay. I've been a fan of ASOIAF since 2013 and love your work. But I don't want you to feel frustrated or negative. I want you to be happy. You have a beautiful gift in literary and you used it to create an awesome world that I've come to enjoy deeply. And while I know the pressure is still present, I don't want that pressure to ruin this process for you.


I sincerely hope you have a good time in Guadalajara, a very merry Christmas and the happiest of new years ahead. :)

Cheers,

Andrew
comments.subject: hola

comments.article:
I would posit that you still would not have visited Old Mexico. I was the same as you, spending the first six years of my life in Tucson (and visiting Nogales), and visiting my relatives in El Paso for decades (thus visiting Juarez), but my chance at visiting Mexico proper came when I went down to stay with Kate Elliott and her husband in Puebla. Jay was still in graduate school and was doing a survey of pre-Columbian artifacts, so (as you do) I went down to visit. I got to wander through fields with some archaeologists and eat tacos from roadside vendors. I went shopping with Alis (Kate) and the kids, and wandered the zocalo. I climbed all over the pyramids at Teotihuacan, and got sick after eating cheese in Mexico City. It was a great trip, and I don't think I saw Old Mexico, either.

But it's a start.

I wish, with all my heart, that I could be there but alas, my 2 year old and my 5 month old babies cannot take care of themselves and would make lousy book fair partners were I to drag them there in my feverish, starstruck haste. I cannot believe you will be in my country and that I will be only a few hours away. It would be wonderful if you could share your thoughts and a few words after the visit, what you enjoyed, what you saw, what you ate! Aw man! I wish I could meet you! Welcome to Mexico! You are so, so respected and admired.
comments.subject: Mi Casa es su Casa

comments.article:
I'd regret not asking:

My regional scifi convention for the NYC/Long Island area, I-CON, got shut down in 2013 due to Hurricane Sandy. This caused a lot of financial problems and other hassles which shut overthing down. I thought the con was over and done given that we haven't had one in three years...

...then yesterday I awoke to the announcement that they're finally restarting the con in March 2017. They're still on shaky legs and could really use an A-list scifi author to anchor their return so it doesn't all fall apart again.

By any small chance, did the starts align in such a way that you just happen to be in the NYC area around March-ish?

More likely it will be Winds of Winter work, I know.

www.iconsf.org
comments.subject: New York area convention around March 2017?

comments.article:
Hi George, really excited that you are coming to Guadalajara, I can´t wait to go to your conference.
Have a safe flight and I hope that you enjoy the city and the book fair.
comments.subject: Welcome

comments.article: I'd love to meet you and get some books signed, but well... I live in Germany. Will you come to Europe when "The Winds of Winter" is being published? Pretty pretty please? ;)

George,
I completely understand if you prefer not to answer this question, but will you possibly be writing a series of 'Last Year' posts as you did last year? I'd also just like to thank you for your wonderful stories.

Don
comments.subject: year in review

comments.article:
I don't know. I don't plan these posts in advance, you know, I just blog when I feel like it and have something to say. Sometimes I have one of my minions blog in my stead, when I get too busy.

That has been such a depressing year, I am not sure I want to revisit it in any depth. But we'll see.
comments.subject: Re: year in review
